predict_diagnosis:
1. McCune-Albright Syndrome (MAS)
2. Fibrofolliculoma-associated syndrome (FAS)
3. Neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1)
4. Tuberous sclerosis complex (TSC)
5. Cutaneous neuroendocrine syndrome (CNS)
6. Precocious puberty (PP)
7. Sexual precocity (SP)
8. Adrenal hyperplasia (AH)
9. Congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH)
10. Familial Mediterranean fever (FMF)

Please note that these top 10 diagnoses are based on the provided patient phenotype and are meant to be a starting point for further evaluation and confirmation by appropriate clinical testing and imaging. It is essential to consider other rare and genetic disorders with similar manifestations as well as environmental factors that could contribute to the observed symptoms. A comprehensive clinical assessment, genetic testing, andrological evaluation, and appropriate imaging studies will be helpful in narrowing down the diagnosis.
